title: Fundamentals of Theory
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of theory. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Fundamentals of Analysis
description: Advanced exploration of analysis covering current research and industry practices.

title: Research
description: Interdisciplinary approach to research combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Intermediate Theory
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in theory. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Advanced Practice
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of practice. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Advanced Theory
description: Rigorous treatment of theory theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Methods
description: Advanced exploration of methods covering current research and industry practices.

title: Advanced Methods
description: In-depth analysis of methods principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: MKTG 398 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Analysis
description: In-depth analysis of analysis principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: MKTG 341 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Applications
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of applications. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: MKTG 329 and senior standing or graduate status
